pages.text: These commands allow you to see and modify the state of the Web MIDI File Cache on the server.

pages.title: Size
pages.text: $(l)/mimi cache size$()$(br2)This command may be used by $(l)ops only$() and will list the currently configured server Web MIDI File Cache size (number of songs) and usage.$(br2)EX: $(c:/mimi cache size)/mimi cache size$()

pages.title: Set
pages.text: $(l)/mimi cache set <size>$()$(br2)This command may be used by $(l)ops only$() and will set the size of the server Web MIDI File Cache (number of songs). Setting this value to a value lower than the current usage will $(o)not$() automatically prune the cache.$(br)$(li)$(l)size$() - The number of files to cache on the server.$(br2)EX: $(c:/mimi cache set 100)/mimi cache set 100$()

pages.title: Prune
pages.text: $(l)/mimi cache prune$()$(br2)This command may be used by $(l)ops only$() and will prune the current server Web MIDI File Cache to contain one fewer file than the configured maximum cache size.$(br2)EX: $(c:/mimi cache prune)/mimi cache prune$()

pages.title: Clear
pages.text: $(l)/mimi cache clear$()$(br2)This command may be used by $(l)ops only$() and will clear all currently cached files from the server Web MIDI File Cache.$(br2)EX $(c:/mimi cache clear)/mimi cache clear$()

pages.title: Reload
pages.text: $(l)/mimi cache reload$()$(br2)This command may be used by $(l)ops only$() and will reload the list of MIDI files currently cached by the server from the disk. This may be useful if you add or remove a MIDI file to the server cache folder directly.$(br2)EX: $(c:/mimi cache reload)/mimi cache reload$()
